de.larssh.utils.xml

Class XmlReadingProperty<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.larssh.utils.xml.XmlReadingProperty<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the property type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XmlReadingWritableProperty

    public class XmlReadingProperty<T>
extends Object
    Allows reading attributes of DocumentBuilderFactory and properties of SAXParser and XMLReader in a typed way.

    While this class offers read support only, the extended class XmlReadingWritableProperty shall be used for read-write accessible properties.

        @Nullable
public T get(DocumentBuilderFactory documentBuilderFactory)
        Allows the user to retrieve specific attributes on the underlying implementation.
        Parameters:
        documentBuilderFactory - the document builder factory
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the underlying implementation doesn't recognize the attribute.
        See Also:

      • get

        @Nullable
public T get(SAXParser saxParser)
                throws SAXNotRecognizedException,
                       SAXNotSupportedException
        Returns the particular property requested for in the underlying implementation of XMLReader.
        Parameters:
        saxParser - the SAX parser
        Returns:
        the current value of the property
        Throws:
        SAXNotRecognizedException - when the underlying XMLReader does not recognize the property name.
        SAXNotSupportedException - when the underlying XMLReader recognizes the property name but doesn't support the property.
        See Also:
        XMLReader.getProperty(java.lang.String)

      • get

        @Nullable
public T get(XMLReader xmlReader)
                throws SAXNotRecognizedException,
                       SAXNotSupportedException
        Look up the value of a property.

        It is possible for a XMLReader to recognize a property name but temporarily be unable to return its value. Some property values may be available only in specific contexts, such as before, during, or after a parse.

        XMLReaders are not required to recognize any specific property names.

        Parameters:
        xmlReader - the XML reader
        Returns:
        the current value of the property
        Throws:
        SAXNotRecognizedException - if the property value can't be assigned or retrieved.
        SAXNotSupportedException - when xmlReader recognizes the property name but cannot determine its value at this time.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Property Name
        Returns:
        the property name
